And another thing! The feed takes forever to load. You'll post something and by the time your feed reloads, it's stuff full of so many posts from random influencers and meme accounts that you will never even find the thing that you wrote yourself. Let alone the post of someone you follow.

Also, you can't click on somebody's avatar to see it bigger. My eyes are not good enough to recognize my pals in a one centimeter diameter profile picture. They have provided no easy ways to find the twitter ppl you want to follow. They just assume you want to follow the same ppl as on insta....
Another stupid thing about threads is it doesn't show who you are following. Just how many followers you have. It really isn't a twitter alternative at all. It's an Instagram extension.
This place is on the right track and the ppl who made it clearly get what it should be. Threads is built to advertise to the userbase, not to use as an actual service. It's a garbage app for no one.
The use case for Threads is that it's twitter for ppl who really like instagram. So like 7 ppl are amped as hell rn.

And saying "well the cap is going to go up!" is meaningless because the cap was expected to go up for all the other players signing around the league too. You are worth what the market says you are worth.
I hate that Nylander is likely gonna end up the sacrificial lamb here but you have to set a standard that if you want to squeeze for every dollar, you're gonna be out on your ass.

I also hate the argument "well it doesn't matter what Nylander's peers are taking because he's comparing to the players on his own team." K well if he only cares about his own team, then he should be pricing himself as a second liner because that's the role he plays for the Leafs.

On the topic of Nylander taking a discount last time that he needs to make up for now. That's narrative is made up. He took a deal on the high end of his comps. It only looks like a discount now because Matthews came in and got 5 years term at big money and Marner blew his comps out of the water.
